Articles.Content: I have been inspired by some of the submissions to do an ISRU Jool 5/Grand Tour. More later.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/VoTYu/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

I'm working on a submission for this challenge. Currently trying to polish things up and follow the rules. In doing so, I encountered three instances of part clipping, as seen in the three images in this Imgur album. The first one is an instance of a strut clipping through a fairing. The second is an instance of a separator clipping into a external command seat, and the third is a minor case of a radial parachute clipping into a radial decoupler. Might not even be visible from the image. Is any one of these in violation of the rules? Thanks in advance.
[@sdj64](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/100819-sdj64/)Can I clip drills?

[@sdj64](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/100819-sdj64/)Can I use [mk2 expansion](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/109145-105-mk2-expansion-v1611-update-11132015/)?

[@rocketbuilder](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/154102-rocketbuilder/) I'm no sdj64, but I have asked that before, and appearntly, as long as we don't use the reactor or the nuclear jet, it's fine for Jool-5 purposes.

Hi all, sorry for the lack of comments recently, I've moved and had problems with internet this past week with no end in sight.  For those few with pending submissions I'm working on them when I get the time and bandwidth.

Drills should not be clipped when they are retracted.  It is okay if they clip when they are moving to the deployed position or when deployed.  Mk2 Expansion is exactly as SpaceplaneAddict said.

Thanks for checking, IncongruousGoat, all three of those are fine.  Any clipping of structural parts through fairings is okay because they are buggy with regards to when and where you can place struts.

Hi ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I'm making a new SSTO for the ISRU Jool 5 Challenge to try the mission in my 1.05 hard mode career:

![LEB3iPW.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/LEB3iPW.jpg)

But before to start the mission, i would like to know if the "Drill-O-Matic" and the "Convert-O-Tron" in the two pictures below are ok with the clipping rules of this challenge ?

![J9Pgxgv.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/J9Pgxgv.jpg)![y53pPzf.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/y53pPzf.jpg)

Fly safe with Valentina !

Can I use modified stock ships? I want to use two modified Aeris 4As to land on Laythe. Also, can I be dropping useless parts of the ship after they become useless?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-24T03:54:37Z" title="01/24/2016 03:54  AM" data-short="8 yr">January 24, 2016</time> by Findthepin1**

Hello!

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/lRIqa/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Here is my submission to the Jool 5 challenge!

The mission was conducted in version 1.05, completely stock.

3 kerbals came along for the ride, Jeb as a pilot, Bob as a scientist & navigator, and Bill as a passenger along for the ride.

The mission was 1 launch from Kerbin, with no refueling. Total mission cost was 732,680 funds.

No additional rovers, probes, etc were brought along.

This was completed in Career mode in a legitimate save-no cheating in of money or funds here!

Sorry for not providing video, but I suspect my computer would have choked if I tried to do that. The game was already running disgustingly slowly-just getting to LKO took over an hour.

Oh, and there is a typo in the album. I really did mean solar, not soalr. Sorry.

If anyone has any questions, please ask.

[@IncongruousGoat](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/157062-incongruousgoat/) that's pretty awesome! I've been working on my Jool-5 mission since just after New Years. 

I may have been a bit ambitious about mine, I have over 200 screenshots of just the orbital assembly of my ship. My transfer ship with everything attached has 649 parts and runs at about 3-4 fps.
[@Racescort666](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/137852-racescort666/)Thanks! Don't worry about the 3-4 fps thing, happened to me too. And good luck with your efforts!

Congratulations, IncongruousGoat, you have completed the Jool 5 challenge on Level 1!  Your mission reminds me of some of the really early Jool 5s when there were no Kerbodyne engines, but of course that's because you didn't unlock them yet!  Great job making do without some of the most powerful parts researched.

[@astrobond](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/127649-astrobond/) The amount of clipping looks pretty minimal, you're good to go.

\*blinks\* \*blinks again\* \*rubs eyes\* 

I... got accepted? HUZZAH!

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/8A6w9/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Ok. part 1. I don't know how many parts there will be but there will probably be around 4 for the assembly alone because this album represents about 25% of the screen captures that I have of the assembly. I haven't completed the whole mission yet but Taranis Transfer is currently en route to Jool. 

A little on the name: Taranis is the Celtic god of thunder. I originally had everything named "Jool XXXX" but decided that I wanted it to be more flavorful and started looking through [Wikipedia's list of deities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lists_of_deities) for inspiration. I think I'll have a mission named after a bunch of Norse or Egyptian gods at some point with each module named after a different god but that's for the future and will probably happen after 1.1 drops.

Anyway, if the judging panel wishes for more screen shots or any of the lift vehicles be re-flown, I can oblige but the payloads are what they are. Honestly, the most agonizing part was docking everything together and I feel like I documented that pretty well.

Hi all ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I started a Mission Report, that's just the beginning, but if someone want's to get a look, that's here ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") :

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/130960-isru-rhino-ssto-explorer-mk1-jool-5-mission/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/130960-isru-rhino-ssto-explorer-mk1-jool-5-mission/)

I will update as soon as i go further in the mission...

Fly safe with Valentina ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/vJOsz/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Part 2. Hopefully using hardware that was in orbit before I decided to do a mission to refuel the transfer vehicle.

Can I leave debris? Like, my plan is to go to Jool with everything I need for Jool, then to come back to Kerbin with only the return stuff. If I can do that, I should be okay to go.
